awd_titl_txt: Automated Reasoning in Geometry and Mechanics
awd_abstract_narration: The goal of this project is to study automated reasoning in elementary          geometry, differential geometry, and mechanics as an extension of our           previous and current work.  It covers not only theorem proving, but             also formula derivation.  In each of these three areas, the following           research will be conducted:  (1) to improve existing proving                    techniques; (2) To further study mechanical formula derivation; (3) to          collect a significant number of worked examples; (4) to improve Ritt-           Wu's decomposition algorithm and other key algorithms; (5) to combine           Ritt-Wu's method with Collins' method in elementary geometry; (6) to            release an automated reasoning system; (7) to study practical                   applications of our techniques to areas such as kinematic synthesis of          linkages and mechanisms, CAD/CAM, etc; (8) to study theoretical issues          related to our techniques.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
